column1: nice zippy opening delivery, good length outside off, Warner allows it to go through
what a brute! This climbs from back of a length, Warner has to jump out of the line as it carries at head height to Buttler

given caught behind, and Warner has reviewed straight away! He made the call in the instant he was given. Another cracking delivery, short of a length, nips back at Warner and beats the inside edge, but the replay shows that glanced the glove!
Archer is flying, keeps it short of a length and this rises through to Buttler as Carey stays inside the line
beaten again! 91mph, fuller outside off, Carey is caught a little flat-footed as he reaches out to drive
missed run out chance! Short of a length, dropped square into the off side, there's all sorts of confusion between the batsmen. Moeen comes in from gully, can't quite underarm it into the stumps
over the wicket, 89mph/144kph, back of a length at middle, played back to the bowler
fuller at middle and leg, 92mph/148kph, aims to whip it through the leg side but it deflects off the pads towards point
top edged hook! A short ball on leg stump, gets underneath it but falls short of long leg...not much out of the middle so far
good length at the stumps, flicked backward of square and Rashid tumbles down to make the save at short fine leg. Almost done by a bobble off the outfield
edged, caught behind! What a start from England. Carey tries to give himself a touch of room to the leg side, shapes a drive at a good-length delivery but can only get a thin nick to Buttler
full outside off, 89mph/144kph, plinks a drive into the covers
lovely delivery as Finch is caught on the crease against a good-length ball outside off and it zips past the outside edge. That was 95.8mph / 154.2kph!
all the way! Takes on the short ball, gets well underneath this pick-up pull off his hip. For a second it looked like it might find the man at deep square but it was well back
what a comeback! That's a 91mph/146kph leg-cutter which scorchers past the outside edge
92mph/148kph, Finch is hurried into a forward push that finds cover
nips back off a good length and strikes Finch a painful blow off the bottom hand
short on off stump, Finch hops back into the crease and nudges to midwicket to keep the strike
short of a length, punched off the back foot to the covers
back of a length at off stump, solidly pushed towards mid-off
full and very wide, Finch reaches out for it, gets a toe end that runs fine of third man
that's a much more confident shot, but picks out the cover fielder as he drives off the back foot
gets some fortune this time, feet stuck in the crease, throws his hands into a drive at a full delivery and it takes a thick inside edge past the stumps
nicely timed, short of a length outside off, punched through the covers for a brace
misfield gives Smith a boundary, short of a length, he shovels a pull through square leg and the deep fielder can't cut it off
gets squared up this time, back of a length, played into midwicket
that's a cracker! Jags away from back of a length, beats the outside edge and carries nicely. Something in this pitch
clears deep square leg! Terrific pull shot by Smith, the delivery wasn't that short, just back of a length and swung away
played back down the pitch, was aiming into midwicket
run out with a direct hit! Brilliant work from Eoin Morgan. Pushed towards mid-on, the captain quickly in and an underarm into the stumps. Smith well short
back of a length at off stump, defended
touch shorter, pushed firmly square into the off side
just wide of a diving Buttler! Angled into the pads, glanced off the face of the bat and not that far from the big dive
nice piece of timing, but mid-on could have done better...leans forward and times the on-drive, Curran dives over it
inswinging yorker at off stump, 94mph/151kph, jabbed into the covers
doesn't really time this pull, sends it into square leg
very full outside off, driven to long-off
quicker, flatter at leg stump, pushed to the off side...out of the front from Rashid

big appeal for lbw from Buttler as Stoinis presses forward, certainly came off the bat in the end. And England have reviewed! Ha, he couldn't have middled that any better. Not one of the better reviews. Even Buttler has a laugh
full at off stump, driven down the ground
a little shorter, played off the back foot to the bowler
almost pops this up to cover, the ball grips and sticks in the surface, pushes with hard hands to the off side
good start, on a length at middle and off, pushed into the covers
that's a strong shot! A fraction short from Jordan and Stoinis latches on with a dismissive pull in front of square
pushes this up further, punched off the back foot back to Jordan
more good work by the captain, diving to his left at cover to intercept a drive
on the pads, worked through midwicket where Bairstow collects in the deep
cloths this lofted drive, but manages to clear mid-off on the edge of the ring. A slower ball from Jordan and Stoinis was through his shot
very full, wide outside off, swung down to long-on as he swings across the line
full toss wide outside off, driven very firmly at cover and this has done some damage to Morgan. Looks like a finger on his right hand. Maybe a dislocation? Physio is straight out there
worked away as play resumes
waits for this to turn outside off, pushed to deep cover
fuller at the stumps, a quicker delivery, defended
goes for the sweep, deflects off his pad and it isn't far from bobbling into leg stump
full at the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
angled into the pads, Finch misses out as this deflects through to Buttler along the ground
full at leg stump, whipped through midwicket and he can't get back for the second
goes for the yorker, it;'s a straight low full toss, driven to mid-off...a slower ball at 69mph
back of a length, driven off the back foot to deep cover
taps a straight delivery just to the on side, screams of 'two, two' from Finch but he's kept to a single
tossed up on the stumps and worked through mid-on
flighted, Stoinis cuts across a shot into the off side, chips it but safely into a gap
tosses up the legbreak and Finch leans out to dead-bat this
thumped down the ground! Finch leaves this crease and leaves a mark on Rashid, swung mightily over long-on, despite there being a man back
floated up and driven through the off side

Rashid's googly beats Stoinis on the inside - umpire Burns says no! Maybe outside the line, Stoinis completely foxed there, he's been done that way before... but no review from England. Hawk-Eye says it was bouncing over leg stump
back of a length, 80mph/129kph and Finch taps it down defensively
swatted over backward square leg! Picked up and he finds the gap, using Jordan's pace and incoming angle to good effect
half an appeal, Finch struck on the pads playing back, runs away for one
full on off, Stoinis crunches up and over, almost carries all the way to long-on running in
slower ball, Finch didn't seem to pick it but managed to adjust, heaved through backward square again! Lost his shape but managed to hoick four more

dragged on! Short ball, coming back in at pace, Finch seems surprised by it and can only chop down into his timbers! Jordan roars in celebration, that's a big breakthrough, with Australia rebuilding nicely
lummoxed over long-off! Doesn't matter about picking 'em if you get to the pitch and hit that sweetly through the line!
floated up and dinked through mid-off
googly, comes back and Maxwell isn't in a position to play it, gloves the ball down
tossed up on leg stump and he nurdles his first run into a gap at midwicket
full, wide of the stumps, tempting Stoinis out and he chips up and over cover towards the sweeper

steered to slip, Rashid again finishes his spell with a wicket! Stoinis hangs his head but that was indicative of his struggles against spin... hung back, spotted too late that it was a big-turning legbreak, could only watch in horror as he directed it straight to Malan, diving to his right
shortish and tucked to the leg side
round the wicket, back of a length and Agar prods it back to the bowler
bit of width on offer, 82mph/132kph and this is chopped through the covers to the sweper
angling in with the arm and worked through square leg
round the wicket, speared in at 90mph/145kph, draws a waft play-and-miss from Agar
short ball, 89mph on the hip and Agar nudges to midwicket for one
round the wicket, pushed through and Agar is trapped on the front pad... not turning enough, as England go up for lbw
floated up and worked against the spin through midwicket
over the wicket, worked off the stumps to leg
flighted, Agar has a hack, edged past the diving Malan's left hand! Sliced off the back foot but he got enough on it and the ball runs away past short fine leg
tossed up and clipped leg side coming forwards
pushed through outside off, Maxwell opens the face and steers one square
length ball, 81mph/130kph and Maxwell clips through midwikcet, comes back for two
skidding on outside off, 82mph and he opens the face, guides straight to short third man for one
full and wide of off stump, 86mph/138kph and Agar stabs a couple through backward point, Moeen does well on the rope
round the wicket now, 86mph, this jumps off the pitch and hits the shoulder of the bat, runs down to third man
short ball, pulled through square between two men set back and they pick up a couple
pitched up, 88mph/141kph attempted yorker and Maxi digs it out through cover for one to keep the strike
legcutter, hits Maxwell on the thigh pad playing back, Archer was on his knees asking for lbw... high and leg side, I think. Deflected away for a leg bye
round the wicket, fired in on the stumps and Agar clips through midwicket
flung down full and wide of the stumps at 93mph/149kph and Maxwell can only jam one to deep point, a bellow of frustration audible on the stump mic
dug in, 89mph/143kph and Agar gets a top-edge on the pull for a couple to fine leg
pitched up, 92mph/148kph and whipped crisply in front of deep midwicket for a couple
spears in the yorker, pace up at 91mph/147kph and Agar can't do anything but keep it out
clubbed over long-on, just above the leaping Archer! Slower ball and he had to manufacture the hit, a real baseball slug, just beyond the man on the fence
pace off outside off and he settles for prodding one through cover
round the wicket, another slowie and Agar mistimes a cut for one to backward point
back of the hand, wide of the stumps and Maxwell slashes it through point to the sweeper
round the wicket, full on the stumps, 82mph/132kph and Agar nudges it down the ground to long-on
full on the stumps, 84mph and drilled to long-on for just a single
yorker length, 89mph and wide of the stumps, bullocked through extra by Maxwell! Such power, should have been tough to hit, but he forces it away through the infield, beats the man out, too

heaves at a length ball, nicked to the keeper! Unusual dismissal at this stage of the innings, but it'll work for England... Jordan hitting that hard length again, as he did at the death on Friday, and Maxwell is too leg side as he swings for the hills and edges through. Was seeing it well, but that's going to dent Australia's hopes of getting 150
pitched up and dinked into the covers for a single
slugged down the ground, 90mph/145kph and he uses that pace, thumping a half-volley fine of Moeen at long-on!
full and wide of the stumps, chopped for a single
pitched up wide of off, 88mph/141kph and Cummins slaps through point
flung full on the stumps, Cummins squeezes it out through backward point
round the wicket, 90mph/145kph but sliding down the leg side
90mph yorker outside off as Agar comes across, hits him on the boot and ricochets to short third man
slower ball, short outside off... and called wide on height. Looked tight from side on. May have been a knuckle ball bouncer?
length ball, Cummins top-edges it over short third man! Rashid turns and givers chase but this will run away
Woof! Smoked down the ground! Cummins sets himself and thrashes another length ball back over the bowler's head... Shot, sir
sprays this down the leg side, Buttler can't grab it cleanly... more extras in the over, Archer not enjoying this quite so much now

goes back to basics, nails the 92mph/148kph yorker... and then runs Agar out as he comes looking for the single! He made an instinctive move out of his crease, even as the ball went straight back to the bowler. Archer dismissively pings the stumps, but this has been a good over for Australia
fullish length, 91mph and Starc hacks across the line, gets a thick inside edge, and they'll scamper two to finish an 18-run over. How crucial will that be?
over the wicket, short of a length, played with a straight bat and it runs off a thick inside edge to the leg side

huge appeal for lbw! Full, swings in at leg stump, probably doing too much as Bairstow plays across the line but Finch has called the review. Takes the back leg in the end. Yep, missing leg stump. Umpires' call on impact as well for what it's worth
full, wider outside off, driven without any timing to the off side
good length at middle and leg, hint of swing, takes the pad again
full outside off, 92mph/148kph, a bottom-handed drive back to the bowler
spoils the over, although it's not off the bat, swinging into the pads and it deflects just wide of Carey
good start, back of a length, hits the bat hard as Buttler defends to the on side
edged, but doesn't carry to slip! Buttler almost looking to steer this towards third man
backs away to the leg side and then crunches a pull when Cummins saw him moving, banged it in short, finds deep square leg

good length outside off, angled into backward point. A direct hit from Maxwell and they'll check with the third umpire. Buttler didn't ground his bat, just ran across the crease, but got his foot down well in time
great shot! Moves to the leg side again and this time plays to the off, threads the covers with a wonderfully crisp drive
big appeal for lbw! Fantastic yorker, knocks Buttler off his feet, but no review this time. Right on the boot, missing leg stump
throws his hands into a drive, on the up over mid-off, not perfectly timed but a handsome stroke as he took advantage of some width
that's a better shot! Full outside off, a fantastically crisp straight drive rockets off his bat
tries again, but loses his shape this time, the bottom hand drags this into the leg side
a straight full toss, 90mph/145kph, driven to the covers

he's hit his own stumps! Out hit wicket. Was a quick short ball outside off, Bairstow was beaten as he went for the pull and as his bat swung around from the shot it tapped leg stump. Odd way to go, big wicket for Australia
angled into the pads, clipped behind square
over the wicket, full at leg stump, clipped into midwicket
good length outside off, pushed to the covers
well bowled, tight line outside off, Buttler can't thread a gap in the covers
uses his feet, comes at the bowler, bunts it straight back to him
short of a length at off stump, a bottom-handed flick into midwicket...four dot balls in a row
and that breaks the run of dots...a dismissive thump over mid-on from a perfectly good length delivery, Buttler got onto the front foot and crunched it down the ground. Into the rope on the full
good length at off stump, opens the face and finds backward point
back of a length, no width on offer, Malan takes his bottom hand off the bat as it runs off the face to point
a strangled appeal for caught behind as Malan misses a pull, the ball glances off the back leg to Carey
full, pushed down the leg side, Starc just lets that one get away from him
latches on with the pull this time, short of a length and he whips it through midwicket off one leg
full and straight, flicked in the air over the square leg straight to the deep man
short outside leg stump, poor ball, Buttler manages to catch up with it with a toe-ended pull wide of short fine leg...good over in the end for England
back of a length at off stump, angled down to third man
a yorker outside off stump, driven firmly but straight to cover
goes for it again, a full toss this time, Buttler misses out as he finds cover with the drive...Agar intercepts with a dive
ouch! Malan misses the pull and gets whacked in the stomach You could hear the cry of 'oh, no'
banged in short, flies over Malan's head and it's called wide on height
full outside off, nicely driven but finds cover
loses his shape on this heave, but gets a boundary as it skews off a thick inside edge wide of short fine leg
round the wicket, pushed to the covers
goes deep in the crease and knocks a straight delivery into midwicket
tucked off the pads through square leg
fuller, at the stumps, worked into midwicket and that's excellent running to make the second
shorter outside off but he can't find the gap as he drives onto the covers
flatter delivery, pulled through midwicket and this time they can't make the second. Tidy start from Maxwell
uses his feet straightaway and drills a drive into the non-striker, gets denied a run
skips down the pitch again, worked along the ground into midwicket
goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps out to deep midwicket, didn't connect as cleanly as he wanted
down the pitch, almost yorks himself, skews off the toe end to short third man
nicely bowled, tossed up at middle and leg, the googly, slides off the face to short third man
full at middle, clipped down the ground to long-on. Good start from Zampa. Back-to-back tight overs from spin
goes for the reverse sweep, gets it over point and places it well enough to beat deep cover running around the rope
back-to-back boundaries...excellent footwork, moves to the leg side, opens up the off and square cuts wide of backward point
well bowled, beats him outside off with one that grips and spins away
hint of turn again, Malan aiming to the leg side and gets an outside edge to short third man
round the wicket, steps outside leg and drives to long-off
full at the stumps, pushed down the ground to long-off
another reverse sweep, this time against a very full ball outside off and it scurries past Carey's boot down to third man
strong thump! Stand and deliver this time from Malan, just gives himself a hint of room and swings cleanly straight down the ground
a delicate dab from wide outside off, walked right across the crease, can't beat Starc at short third man
full at the stumps and pushed down to long-off
full outside off, Malan steps across and works it back along the pitch
played off the back foot into the off side
length outside off, 83mph/134kph and Buttler dabs this into the off side for a single - he's been content to tick at around a run a ball so far
short on the hip at 83mph and Malan swats it to fine leg for one
stroked through the covers, just a push in front of the sweeper for a couple
short, 84mph/136kph at the body and swatted leg side, Buttler immediately wants two with Stoinis running in from deep midwicket, and gets it
rammed through the covers for four! Not a bad ball, 87mph/139kph, full length with scrambled seam, somehow Buttler wrists it through the off side and it races away!
back of a length as Buttler shimmies across, nudges this into a gap leg side... Buttler taking it up a notch in that over, 12 fuss-free runs added
round the wicket, tossed up on leg and Malan reverse-sweeps one into the covers
fired in full, Buttler reverse-gumbos through backward point! Fast hands, rapped away past the man on the edge of the ring
tossed up, Buttler walks across and prods through the off side
tries to come down, Agar slows his pace up, missed flicking across the line
pushed through and nurdled off the pads
flat delivery on off stump, Buttler bunts down to long-off - eight off the over, England exactly on the RRR
short outside off, maybe a cutter and Buttler is up on his toes to clip through point
thrashed over cover, 91mph/147kph from Cummins but it's a hittable length and he just makes room and swings hard through the line!
full and straight, 90mph/145kph and flicked away through backward square leg
back of a length, back off and steered towards backward point - 'Nooo!!' the call
dug in short, 90mph and swatted on the pull! Dispatched behind square, Agar can't get around on the rope
short ball, sits up as he cracks a pull to deep square
tossed up and tickled down the ground for one

Malan plinks one to deep midwicket! Agar breaks through, chips out the in-form Malan and ends the second-wicket stand... Picked his area, looking to slog-sweep with the spin, but didn't quite get hold of it and Stoinis took a straightforward catch running around
not quite to the pitch, extends the arms... donked in front of extra cover! Didn't seem as if he'd got hold of it but powered away to the rope
reverse-sweeps behind the sweeper now! Stoinis had moved straighter in response to the first shot and is then dragged the other way by a rasping swipe through square
punched down the ground for one
flighted, this spins a touch as Banton drops back and dabs it down softly
short ball from round the wicket, 91mph/147kph and he flicks behind square on the leg side, comes back for two
fuller on off, tapped into the covers
full length, 88mph/141kph and Buttler can only prod this to the man at cover
dug in short, Buttler swings and can't connect... wide on height
speared into the pads, deflected into the leg side for a leg bye
short of a length outside off, 87mph/139kph and steered through backward point, behind the sweeper and Banton gets off the mark with two
flung down full and straight, 'awwws!' among the fielders as Banton blocks to leg
tossed up and punched down the ground
Banton holes out now! Slog-swept but picks out the man at deep backwards square... Is is happening again?? Wickets are just what Australia need, and Agar has his second. Poor shot choice, really
pushed through on the stumps and Morgan turns to leg playing around his pad
looped up on leg stump, clipped through square as he closes the face
tosses this up straight and again Morgan nurdles one to the leg side
appeal for lbw as Buttler paddles leg side, then sets off blindly, Morgan sends him back... No way that was straightening enough on middle and leg
over the wicket, flighted legbreak and Morgan gets tucked up reverse-sweeping, dobbles behind square for one
drilled through the covers! Buttler stands tall and threads the needle between short extra and the man on the edge of the ring!
lobbed up on the stumps and worked behind square
smoked down the ground! Fullish in the slot and Morgan just plants the front foot and belts through the line

attempts to sweep this time, hit on the front pad and Australia go up... in fact, Finch has reviewed Michael Burns' not-out decision. Looked like he was outside the line of off, to me, maybe not spinning enough either. Yep, umpire's call on impact, missing off stump

slapped on the up, straight to cover, Maxwell grabs a head-height chance! No doubt about this, Morgan shakes his head and trudges off, looking to go hard right to the end and it's given Australia another window of opportunity
flattish delivery outside off and Buttler prods it for one
slung down wide of the stumps from round the wicket, Moeen rocks back and cuts through point
tucked into a gap leg side, just the single
lobbed up wide of off, Moeen dances down but can only jam the ball to short midwicket
full outside off, plays a late dab towards short third man and sets off
tossed up and Buttler takes the safety first approach with a bunt down to long-off
pushes through the legbreak outside off, Buttler goes back and steers a drive square
pongo from Mo! Always a risk bowling spin this late into the game... Moeen dances out and smashes it over long-off for six!
rifled over cover, Moeen has stepped up to the plate here! Stays still, opens the body up and drills this wide of long-off
lobbed up and he comes across to stab through point
wins it with a straight six! Buttler waltzes out and mows Zampa over the sight screen, a monster hit to finish - England win by six wickets with seven balls to spare!
